intro: Potentilla verna var. heterotricha, commonly known as the early potentilla, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features small, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, often before the leaves fully develop. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This species is often found in moist, calcareous soils in woodland edges and meadows.
